page.title: 19Recreation in Silverdale
page.content: The Allotments are like a little farm. They are rented by people who have no garden to their house.Growing food here is cheaper than buying it from a shop and much fresher.The people who rent the allotments are worried because the local council may take the land for building new houses. In Silverdale some children have built a BMX stunt ramp.It is not for high jumps but for freestyle riding.They all helped to make it from scrap wood and saved up for the paint to make sure it doesn't rot. Much leisure time is spent at the public library in Silverdale.When a book is chosen,it is taken to the desk where a card is put through the computer.The library provides magazines,papers,records and hundreds of books.It also supplies information and maps or guides.It has news of evening classes & entertainment
